---
title: "Clinical Psychology PhD Application Resources"
---

<br/>
**Non-profits/Student-led groups with awesome programs**    

* [Project Short](https://www.project-short.com/) matches applicants with mentors in a related field to provide one-to-one mentoring. "One of the goals of Project SHORT is to offer pro-bono mentoring for individuals from diverse and underrepresented populations in STEM."    

* Application Statement Feedback Program ([ASFP](asfp.io)): "Our goal is to provide fast, constructive feedback and editing support for the research/personal statements of PhD applicants in psychology, with an emphasis on underrepresented minorities and/or those who are not ‘in the know.’"   

* [Psychin'Out](https://psychinout.org/) has a [resource hub](drive.google.com/drive/u/0/folders/1INKBbyDCCNqSPDMIqK8kpdLk9k8Pqyof) of application materials with a slack channel for people at different stages of their careers.    

* Application Group for applicants interested in eating disorders [Getting in to Grad School](www.psychphdeat.com/resources)   


<br/>
**Universities' Programs**    

Some universities have programs for underrepresented applicants. You usually need to apply for those. Even if you don't apply for these programs, their websites usually have helpful information from previous years' workshops.   

* Harvard Prospective Ph.D. & RA Event in Psychology ([PPREP](https://psychology.fas.harvard.edu/pprep))      
* [UNC Diversifying Psychology Weekend](https://psychology.unc.edu/diversifying-psychology-weekend/)    
* [Rutgers Diversifying Psychology Program](https://sites.rutgers.edu/rdpd/)
